intro: Calotis lappulacea, commonly known as the narrow-leaved calotis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Calotis lappulacea is often found in open habitats such as coastal dunes and inland plains.
